course_description: This course introduces concepts of exposure science. Students will learn how contaminants are transported from sources to receptors and how human receptors are affected by such contact. Varying exposure science approaches, across a range of environmental media, including air, water, soil, and internal biological matrices, will be considered. Methods of assessment including direct monitoring of environmental media, modeling, as well as biomarkers of exposure will be presented and discussed in detail. Students will examine the literature of exposure science through readings and in-class article discussions.  Offered in conjunction with EH 510, this course is required for and limited to EH-EPI MPH students; EH and GEH students should take EH 510.
prerequisites: This class is for students enrolled in EOHEPIMSPH or EOHEPIMPH plans only.
schedule_location: F 10am-11:50am in Claudia Nance Rollins AUD
